10 Best Monsoon Getaways That're Less Than 8 Hours Away From Delhi

By Shoba
73611 Interested |
105K  Views
Photo source: Patan Mahal

There is another level of joy that comes with seeing the transition from hot, hotter, hottest Delhi summer to see it raining and what better way to make it more joyful than by planning a mini vacation? Of course, longer trips are hard to plan and even harder to convince people to come with you. But a weekend escape during a glorious rainy season can be exactly what everyone wants and needs. 

So, to sort you out with the best picks where you can book this mini vacation, check out our roundup!

Overview

 
  1. 1. Khas Bagh, Jaipur
  2. 2. Jims Jungle Retreat, Corbett National Park
  3. 3. Malji Ka Kamra, Churu
  4. 4. Patan Mahal, Rajasthan
  5. 5. Castle Kanota, Jaipur
  6. 6. Soulitude By The Riverside, Nainital
  7. 7. Alila Fort, Bishangarh
  8. 8. Neemrana Fort Palace, Neemrana
  9. 9. Antrix Resorts & Retreat, Rishikesh
  10. 10. Ratan Villas Sariska, Alwar

Khas Bagh, Jaipur

Photo source: Khas Bagh
Photo source: Khas Bagh
Photo source: Khas Bagh

Khas Bagh, Jaipur

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Khas Bagh is no more than a ten-minute drive from Amer Fort on farms around the city of Jaipur. Built on the lines of a Haveli but spread out like a country home with large open terraces, courtyards, and verandas, the property offers 18 spacious suites. Ransher Singh, a polo player, is the owner and host. A stable of robust polo ponies shares the four-acre space that Khas Bagh is set on. An inviting swimming pool on the estate is just made for a relaxing day with a tall drink at hand, and visits to the elephant camp, horse safaris, and riding lessons are some activities you can undertake.

Distance From Delhi (approx.): 5 hr 5 min (243.0 km)

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 5,800

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 12 PM & 11 AM respectively

Social Media/ Website: Khas Bagh

Pro-Tip: Guide To An Awesome Day In The Pink City

Jims Jungle Retreat, Corbett National Park

Photo source: Jim's Jungle Retreat
Photo courtesy: Jim's Jungle Retreat
Photo courtesy: Jim's Jungle Retreat

Jim's Jungle Retreat, Ramnagar

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Jims Jungle Retreat in the southern forests of Corbett offers 18 cottages and lodges close to a seasonal river that comes alive during monsoons. The retreat combines luxury with a concept that borrows as much from the forest bungalows as from the enduring architectural legacy of the local villages. The land features water bodies and open spaces with native shrubs and trees for birds to nest, and animals like deer and birds can be seen walking through the natural fencing, creating a vital connection between man and jungle.

Distance From Delhi (approx.): 5 hr 13 min (263.1 km)

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 5,800

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 1 PM & 11 AM respectively

Social Media/ Website: Jim's Jungle Retreat

Malji Ka Kamra, Churu

Photo source: Malji Ka Kamra
Photo source: Hotel Malji Ka Kamra
Photo source: Hotel Malji Ka Kamra

Malji Ka Kamra, Churu

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Churu is a quaint town and a delightful getaway in the fresco region of Shekhawati. Amidst sprawling havelis, Churus heritage buildings are in various stages of decay, but thanks to crusaders like Deepak Balan (born here, educated overseas), who have kick-started a passionate movement to conserve the city's history and architecture. Visit Malji Ka Kamra, set within a restored Haveli that brings into focus the regions rich heritage and conservation history, which is a rare proposition.

Distance From Delhi (approx.): 6 hr 7 min (281.4 km)

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 5,000

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 2 PM & 11 AM respectively

Social Media/ Website: Malji Ka Kamra

Patan Mahal, Rajasthan

Photo source: Patan Mahal
Photo source: Patan Mahal
Photo source: Patan Mahal

Patan Mahal, Patan

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Patan, up to the early 18th century, was the centre of a small state ruled by the Tomara clan. The Battle of Patan, one of the last great battles in Indian history between the Marathas and the Rajputs, supported by the Mughals, was fought here. Surrounded by high Aravallis on one side and a private farm on the other, Patan Mahal has 19 spacious and elegantly furnished palace suites opening to large terraces. This palace hotel is a perfect getaway from Delhi and is connected to Shekhawati and Jaipur. You can undertake treks to the monsoon palace, craft centres like bangle-making units, and so on.

Distance From Delhi (approx.): 4 hr 2 min (179.8 km)

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 12,000

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 2 PM & 11 AM respectively

Social Media/ Website: Patal Mahal

Castle Kanota, Jaipur

Photo source: Castle kanota
Photo source: Castle Kanota
Photo source: Castle Kanota

Hotel Castle Kanota, Jaipur

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Catle Kanota, featured as the Viceroy Club in The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel parts 1 and 2, is a stunning property. A definite highlight is the museum, which showcases Thakur Amar Singh's meticulously preserved collection of arms and ammunition, maps, and diaries.

Distance From Delhi (approx.): 4 hr 20 min (278.1 km)

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 4,500

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 12 PM & 11 AM respectively

Social Media/ Website: Castle Kanota

Soulitude By The Riverside, Nainital

Photo source: Soulitude By The Riverside
Photo source: Soulitude By The Riverside
Photo source: Soulitude By The Riverside

Soulitude By The Riverside, Nainital

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Solitude By The Riverside is a nature lovers haven, a birder's paradise, a trekkers dream and an accessible getaway for vacation seekers from the plains. It is an award-winning Himalayan retreat which is just six hours away from Delhi. It's basically a 1940s house, but a lot modern now and is comprised of two cottages. The rooms are warm, earthy, and everything you need to be cosy when it is raining outside!

Distance From Delhi (approx.): 6 hr 13 min (308.8 km)

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 14,000

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 2 PM & 10 AM respectively

Social Media/Website: Solitude By The River

Alila Fort, Bishangarh

Photo source: Alila Fort
Photo source: Alila Fort
Photo source: Alila Fort

Alila Fort Bishangarh, Manoharpur

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Alila Fort in Bishangarh is a 230-year-old fort that has been converted into a heritage resort where you can fulfil your childhood dream of living as royalty. Alila redefines luxury getaways like nothing else, and this one in Bishangarh is no less. It is a refurbished 18th-century fort from which you can get a scenic hilltop view. To give you a full-blown Rajput-like experience, there is a rooftop restaurant that serves classic Rajput dishes.

Distance from Delhi (approx.): 4 hr 32 min (219.4 km)

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 18,000

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 3 PM & 12 PM respectively

Social Media/Website: Alila Fort

Neemrana Fort Palace, Neemrana

Photo source: Neemrana Hotels
Photo source: Neemrana Fort Palace
Photo source: Neemrana Fort Palace

Neemrana Fort Palace, Neemrana

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Enjoy a nice and quaint weekend at the Neemrana Fort Palace. You can choose to take a dip in the pool or take a tour of the town. If you are a history buff, you can ask the manager to walk you through its history. There are many rooms available, and some also include turrets, antique furniture, whirlpool tubs, and kitchenettes. There is also an art deco-style rooftop tent.

Distance From Delhi (approx.): 2 hr 43 min (123.0 km)

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 12,000

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 2 PM & 12 PM respectively

Social Media/Website: Neemrana Fort

Antrix Resorts & Retreat, Rishikesh

Photo courtesy: Antrix Resorts & Retreat
Photo courtesy: Antrix Resorts & Retreat
Photo courtesy: Antrix Resorts & Retreat

Antrix Resorts & Retreat, Rishikesh

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Rishikesh has become the go-to escape for Delhiites, and rightly so. Its the kind of place where you can meet warm, like-minded travellers, try your hand at adventure activities, and stay close to nature. While rafting during the monsoon is a no-go, a glamping getaway at Antrix Resorts & Retreat should very much be on the cards. Take advantage of gorgeous mountain-view rooms, gourmet dining, yoga sessions, and yes, even pool parties to shake things up.

Distance From Delhi (approx.): 5 hr 31 min (265.5 km) 

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 6,600

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 2 PM & 11 AM respectively

Social Media/Website: Antrix Resorts & Retreat

Pro-Tip: Things To Do In Rishikesh: Places To Stay At, Eat, & Activities To Do

Ratan Villas Sariska, Alwar

Photo courtesy: Ratan Villas Sariska
Photo courtesy: Ratan Villas Sariska
Photo courtesy: Ratan Villas Sariska

Ratan Villas Sariska, Alwar

See On Map
BOOK HERE

Not to sound too market-y, but peak grandeur meets top-notch service at Ratan Vilas. It's a luxury resort inside the Sariska Tiger Reserve, which overlooks a serene lake. With a range of stay options, from club and pool-view rooms to royal club cottages and the Maharani suites, it is all about giving you royal treatment. The reserve is also home to majestic tigers, so don't miss the chance to plan a safari and have a wild experience.

Distance From Delhi (approx.): 3 hr 45 min (188.3 km)

Price Per Day (approx.): INR 14,000

Check-in/Check-out Timings: 2 PM & 11 AM respectively

Social Media/Website: Ratan Villas Sariska
